result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Jensen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Defendant is to complete an alcohol and drug abuse assessment (AODA) and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to complete and submit proof of completion to the Clerk of Courts Office and the District Attorney's Office.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A Jensen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Green Lake County DHHS - defendant has completed the AODA assessment

Defendant came into our office to inform us that he is scheduled for an assessment on 10/10/2016 at 8:30 a.m.
43
Payment Plan Agreement/Letter of Understanding
Attorney Joey Roeth

2:11 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to ocunt 1 as repeater and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in.  DA concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty and as a repeater.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as a repeater, strikes the place enhancer and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Roeth.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to: 

-Defendant is to complete an alcohol and drug abuse assessment (AODA) and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to complete and submit proof of completion to the Clerk of Courts Office and the District Attorney's Office.
-$300 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 2:18 p.m.

1:43 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Roeth - talked with the DA and are prepared to resolve today, but need to fill out a plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court will re-call when complete. 

Court adjourned at 1:44 p.m.
